paragraphs.content: Chapter 19
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 19

paragraphs.content: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.

paragraphs.content: Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.

paragraphs.content: The foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour.

paragraphs.content: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.

paragraphs.content: Many will entreat the favour of the prince: and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Many will entreat the favour of the prince: and every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.

paragraphs.content: All the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursueth them with words, yet they are wanting to him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursueth them with words, yet they are wanting to him.

paragraphs.content: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good.

paragraphs.content: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish.

paragraphs.content: Delight is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Delight is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

paragraphs.content: The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.

paragraphs.content: The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.

paragraphs.content: A foolish son is the calamity of his father: and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A foolish son is the calamity of his father: and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.

paragraphs.content: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.

paragraphs.content: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul; but he that despiseth his ways shall die.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul; but he that despiseth his ways shall die.

paragraphs.content: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the LORD; and that which he hath given will he pay him again.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the Lord; and that which he hath given will he pay him again.

paragraphs.content: Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying.

paragraphs.content: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.

paragraphs.content: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.

paragraphs.content: There are many devices in a man’s heart; nevertheless the counsel of the LORD, that shall stand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There are many devices in a man’s heart; nevertheless the counsel of the Lord, that shall stand.

paragraphs.content: The desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar.

paragraphs.content: The fear of the LORD tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The fear of the Lord tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.

paragraphs.content: A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A slothful man hideth his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.

paragraphs.content: Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware: and reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware: and reprove one that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.

paragraphs.content: He that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother, is a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that wasteth his father, and chaseth away his mother, is a son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.

paragraphs.content: Cease, my son, to hear the instruction that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Cease, my son, to hear the instruction that causeth to err from the words of knowledge.

paragraphs.content: An ungodly witness scorneth judgment: and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: An ungodly witness scorneth judgment: and the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.

paragraphs.content: Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools.
